title: Should you ask rhetorical questions in essays, or does it lower the quality of the essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: A rhetorical question is a fundamental option in writing both informative and persuasive essays. It does not lower the quality and may enhance it. Used within the body of the essay, the essayist will usually follow the question with their answer within a paragraph or section. The question serves to pique the interest of the reader. When used at the beginning of the essay, it’s more likely to indicate that the answer will be presented in the essay as a whole. An opening question can be followed with points that could yield more than one answer and the body of the essay would present information for those answers. When used at the end of an essay, the question usually indicates that more thinking is needed (by others or in another essay). It is one of the four basic types of “conclusions.”

The structure of the rhetorical question is open and enclosed at the same time.5The rhetorical question is a question which transcends customary practice as it does not invite a reply. However, its dramatic impact triggers the sense that the question does invite a reply when it doesn’t.The rhetorical questions- in their places of usage- are eloquent, impactful and occasionally soft for integrating a follower, or harsh for confuting a dissenter.
